voicesplitting.voice.hmm

Class HmmVoiceSplittingModelState

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.generic.MidiModelState
      • voicesplitting.voice.VoiceSplittingModelState
        • voicesplitting.voice.hmm.HmmVoiceSplittingModelState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState>

    public class HmmVoiceSplittingModelState
extends VoiceSplittingModelState
implements java.lang.Comparable<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState>
    An HmmVoiceSplittingModelState is used to store an HmmVoiceSplittingModel's current state. It contains a List of the Voices which are currently present in the model, as well as its cumulative probability so far.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 7 April, 2015

    • Method Detail

      • handleIncoming

        public java.util.TreeSet<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState> handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
        Return a TreeSet of all of the possible HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates which we could tansition into given the List of MidiNotes. This is done here using the getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int) method.

        NOTE: It is assumed that the notes Lists passed into this method will be passed chronologically. Specifically, each time this method is invoked, it should be passed the List of MidiNotes which occur next in the MIDI song currently being read.

        Usually, this method is simply called by some HmmVoiceSplittingModel's HmmVoiceSplittingModel.handleIncoming(List) method.

        Specified by:
        handleIncoming in class VoiceSplittingModelState
        Parameters:
        notes - A List of the MidiNotes on which we need to transition.
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates which we've transitioned into. The new HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates should not hold any common mutable objects, since they may modify them in the future.

      • getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive

        private java.util.TreeSet<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState> getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> openVoiceIndices,
                                                                               java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                                                               java.util.List<Voice> newVoices,
                                                                               double logProbSum,
                                                                               int noteIndex)
        This method does the work of getting all of the possible HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates which we could transition into for handleIncoming(List) recursively.

        It uses the helper methods addNewVoicesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int, double[], double, TreeSet) to add MidiNotes into new Voices, and addToExistingVoicesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int, double[], TreeSet) to add MidiNotes into existing Voices.

        Parameters:
        openVoiceIndices - The open voice indices for each note, generated by getOpenVoiceIndices(List, List) initially.
        incoming - A List of the incoming MidiNotes.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices in this HmmVoiceSplittingModelState as it is now. For each recursive call, this should be a deep copy since the Voices that lie within will be changed.
        logProbSum - The sum of the current log probability of this state, including any transitions already made recursively.
        noteIndex - The index of the note which we are tasked with transitioning on.
        Returns:
        A List of all states which could be transitioned into given the parameters.

      • addNewVoicesRecursive

        private void addNewVoicesRecursive(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> openVoiceIndices,
                         java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                         java.util.List<Voice> newVoices,
                         double logProbSum,
                         int noteIndex,
                         double[] newVoiceProbs,
                         double maxValue,
                         java.util.TreeSet<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState> newStates)
        This method does the work for getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int) of adding a MidiNote into a newly created Voice.

        addToExistingVoicesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int, double[], TreeSet) is used to add a MidiNote into an existing Voice.

        Parameters:
        openVoiceIndices - The open voice indices for each note, generated by getOpenVoiceIndices(List, List) initially.
        incoming - A List of the incoming MidiNotes.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices in this HmmVoiceSplittingModelState as it is now. For each recursive call, this should be a deep copy since the Voices that lie within will be changed.
        logProbSum - The sum of the current log probability of this state, including any transitions already made recursively.
        noteIndex - The index of the note which we are tasked with transitioning on.
        newVoiceProbs - The probability of adding the current MidiNote into a new Voice at each possible index.
        maxValue - The maximum value of any number in newVoiceProbs.
        newStates - The List where we will add the newly created HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates.

      • addToExistingVoicesRecursive

        private void addToExistingVoicesRecursive(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> openVoiceIndices,
                                java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                java.util.List<Voice> newVoices,
                                double logProbSum,
                                int noteIndex,
                                double[] existingVoiceProbs,
                                java.util.TreeSet<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState> newStates)
        This method does the work for getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int) of adding a MidiNote into an existing Voice.

        addNewVoicesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int, double[], double, TreeSet) is used to add a MidiNote into a new Voice.

        Parameters:
        openVoiceIndices - The open voice indices for each note, generated by getOpenVoiceIndices(List, List) initially.
        incoming - A List of the incoming MidiNotes.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices in this HmmVoiceSplittingModelState as it is now. For each recursive call, this should be a deep copy since the Voices that lie within will be changed.
        logProbSum - The sum of the current log probability of this state, including any transitions already made recursively.
        noteIndex - The index of the note which we are tasked with transitioning on.
        existingVoiceProbs - The probability of adding the current MidiNote into a new Voice at each possible index.
        newStates - The List where we will add the newly created HmmVoiceSplittingModelStates.

      • getOpenVoiceIndices

        private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getOpenVoiceIndices(java.util.List<MidiNote> incoming,
                                                                    java.util.List<Voice> voices)
        Get a List of the indices at which an existing Voice lies in the given List which each of thie given incoming MidiNotes could be added.
        Parameters:
        incoming - A List of the MidiNotes to check for open Voices.
        voices - A List of the Voices we want to check.
        Returns:
        A List of the open voices in newVoices for each incoming note. return.get(i).get(j) will return the index of the (j+1)th (since it is 0-indexed) open Voice in newVoices for the ith MidiNote from incoming.

      • reverseTransition

        private void reverseTransition(int transition,
                     java.util.List<Voice> newVoices)
        Reverse (undo) the given transition.

        This is used when unwinding the recursive actions of getAllCandidateNewStatesRecursive(List, List, List, double, int).

        Parameters:
        transition - The value of the transition we want to perform on the given note. A negative value tells us that a MidiNote was added to a new Voice placed at index (-transition - 1). Any non-negative value tells us that a MidiNote was added into the existing Voice at that index in newVoices.
        newVoices - The Voices List which contains the transition we want to reverse.

      • doTransition

        private void doTransition(MidiNote note,
                int transition,
                java.util.List<Voice> newVoices)
        Perform the given transition WITHOUT calculating probability.

        The getTransitionProb(MidiNote, int, List) method is used to calculate a transition's probability, and it should be called before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        note - The MidiNote we want to add to a Voice.
        transition - The value of the transition we want to perform on the given MidiNote. A negative value tells us to add the MidiNote to a new Voice at index (-transition - 1). Any non-negative value tells us to add the MidiNote into the existing Voice at that index in newVoices.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices available to have the given MidiNote added to them.

      • getTransitionProb

        private double getTransitionProb(MidiNote note,
                       int transition,
                       java.util.List<Voice> newVoices)
        Get the probability of the given transition, but do not perform that transition.

        This must be called before the given transition is actually performed with doTransition(MidiNote, int, List).

        Parameters:
        note - The MidiNote whose transition probability we want.
        transition - The value of the transition whose probability we want to get, given the MidiNote we want to check. A negative value tells us to add the MidiNote to a new Voice at index (-transition - 1). Any non-negative value tells us to add the MidiNote into the existing Voice at that index in newVoices.
        newVoices - A List of the Voices available to have the given MidiNote added to them.
        Returns:
        The probability of the given transition.

      • getVoices

        public java.util.List<Voice> getVoices()
        Get the Voices which are currently contained by this HmmVoiceSplittingModelState.

      • getScore

        public double getScore()
        Get the probability score of this HmmVoiceSplittingModelState. Here, this is the log of the probability of this state occurring.
        Specified by:
        getScore in class MidiModelState
        Returns:
        logProb

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get the String representation of this HmmVoiceSplittingModelState, which is simply its voices followed by its logProb.
        Overrides:
        toString in class VoiceSplittingModelState
        Returns:
        The String representation of this HmmVoiceSPlittingModelState.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(HmmVoiceSplittingModelState o)
        Compare the given HmmVoiceSplittingModelState to this one and return their difference. They are ordered first by their logProb as returned by getScore(), with higher scores coming first. If the scores are equal, the state with the least number of Voices (from voices) comes first, and if that is equal, the Voices are compared one by one following their natural ordering from the Voice.compareTo(Voice) method.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<HmmVoiceSplittingModelState>
        Parameters:
        o - The HmmVoiceSplittingModelState we are comparing to.
        Returns:
        A positive number if this HmmVoiceSplittingModelState should come first, negative if the given one should come first, or 0 if they are equal.
